      private long unstableGeneration  
      private AtomicBoolean writerTaken
      Currently an index only supports one concurrent writer and so this boolean will act as guard so that only one writer ever exist.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        void initialize​(double ratioToKeepInLeftOnSplit,
                PageCursorTracer cursorTracer)
         throws IOException
        When leaving initialize, writer should be in a fully consistent state.

        Either fully initialized:

        • writerTaken - true
        • GBPTree.lock - writerLock locked
        • cursor - not null
        Of fully closed:
        • writerTaken - false
        • GBPTree.lock - writerLock unlocked
        • cursor - null
        Parameters:
        ratioToKeepInLeftOnSplit - Decide how much to keep in left node on split, 0=keep nothing, 0.5=split 50-50, 1=keep everything.
        cursorTracer - underlying page cursor tracer
        Throws:
        IOException - if fail to open PageCursor

      • put

        public void put​(KEY key,
                VALUE value)
        Description copied from interface: Writer
        Associate given key with given value. Any existing value associated with key will be overwritten.
        Specified by:
        put in interface Writer<KEY,​VALUE>
        Parameters:
        key - key to associate with value
        value - value to associate with key

      • merge

        public void merge​(KEY key,
                  VALUE value,
                  ValueMerger<KEY,​VALUE> valueMerger)
        Description copied from interface: Writer
        If the key doesn't already exist in the index the key will be added and the value associated with it. If the key already exists then its existing value will be merged with the given value, using the ValueMerger.
        Specified by:
        merge in interface Writer<KEY,​VALUE>
        Parameters:
        key - key for which to merge values.
        value - value to merge with currently associated value for the key.
        valueMerger - ValueMerger to consult if key already exists.
        See Also:
        ValueMerger.merge(Object, Object, Object, Object)

      • mergeIfExists

        public void mergeIfExists​(KEY key,
                          VALUE value,
                          ValueMerger<KEY,​VALUE> valueMerger)
        Description copied from interface: Writer
        If the key already exists then its existing value will be merged with the given value, using the ValueMerger. If the key doesn't exist then no changes will be made and false will be returned.
        Specified by:
        mergeIfExists in interface Writer<KEY,​VALUE>
        Parameters:
        key - key for which to merge values.
        value - value to merge with currently associated value for the key.
        valueMerger - ValueMerger to consult if key already exists.
        See Also:
        ValueMerger.merge(Object, Object, Object, Object)

        Description copied from interface: Writer

        Specified by:
        remove in interface Writer<KEY,​VALUE>
        Parameters:

        Returns:
